alert.note: Alert for Clarendon; Kershaw; Lee; Richland; Sumter (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 05 at 11:01PM EDT by NWS Columbia
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Lee, northern Clarendon, Sumter, east central Richland and south central Kershaw Counties through 1145 PM EDT... At 1100 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Floyd to near Bishopville to near Lugoff. Movement was southeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Sumter, Camden, Bishopville, South Sumter, Shaw Air Base, Oakland, Woods Bay State Park, Elliott, Mulberry, Lee State Park, Sumter County Airport, Millwood, Poinsett State Park, Turbeville, Mayesville, Lynchburg, Cane Savannah, Dalzell, Dinkins Mill and Manville. This includes the following highways... Interstate 20 in South Carolina between mile markers 95 and 126. Interstate 95 between mile markers 134 and 146. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
